column1: '''Middle English''' is the name given by historical linguists to the diverse forms of the English language in use between the late 11th century and about 1470
column2: though scholars disagree as to the exact dating of this period. Often abbreviated to M.E.
column3: this form of the English language grew out of [[Old English]] and later transformed into '''Early Modern English''' (the language of Shakespeare). As the language became standardised in the mid-to-late eighteenth century [[Modern English]] was born.

column1: Among [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s writings related to Middle English
column2: we find ''[[Sir Gawain and the Green Knight (edition)|Sir Gawain and the Green Knight]]''
